A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This is bad.  

Nearly every characterization is botched.  You have jokes that are tonally awful for Star Wars.  Iron Man Leia is awful.  The CGI horse things are awful.  The entire quest of Poe\, Finn\, and Love Interest is unnecessary as nothing they do has any bearing on the plot (and arguably it gets a lot of people killed).  Luke Skywalker was going to murder a sleeping teen student?  Are you serious?  You just toss that in there?  His own sister's kid?  The entire characterization of Luke Skywalker is just awful\, plus a really anticlimactic send-off.  

Someone needed to bring the director's vision in line with what's already established in the Star Wars universe.  Snokes?  Phasma?  Rey's parentage (And why she is go good at EVERYTHING)?  Guess none of it mattered at all.  Or at least\, it didn't to Rian Johnson.  

But at least we had a great appearance by Yoda.  Who then Force Lightning-ed a tree.  That might have been handy in some of the prior movies.
